title: Grilled Chicken Adobo Recipe
description: Dark chicken thigh meat is cooked in a rich soy sauce, garlic, and vinegar mixture, then tossed on the grill until crisp. Serve over rice.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Filipino Grilled Chicken Adobo 4.3 (253) 178 Reviews 16 Photos This is a very tasty and easy-to-make Filipino chicken dish made with soy sauce, garlic, and vinegar. I can just as easily double or triple the chicken in this recipe to serve guests at a party. Serve over rice with just a little of the sauce (not too much). Submitted by HEART-OF-MIDLOTHIAN Updated on November 13, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 16 16 16 16 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 35 mins Total Time: 50 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 8 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 ½ cups soy sauce 1 ½ cups water ¾ cup vinegar 3 tablespoons honey 1 ½ tablespoons minced garlic 3 bay leaves ½ teaspoon black pepper 3 pounds skinless, boneless chicken thighs Directions Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat, and lightly oil grate. In a large pot, mix soy sauce, water, vinegar, honey, garlic, bay leaves, and pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil, and place the chicken into the pot. Reduce heat, cover, and cook 35 to 40 minutes. Remove chicken, drain on paper towels, and set aside. Discard bay leaves. Return the mixture to a boil, and cook until reduced to about 1 1/2 cups. Place chicken on the prepared grill, about 5 minutes on each side, until browned and crisp. Serve with the remaining soy sauce mixture. I Made It Print 266 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 255 Calories 7g Fat 11g Carbs 37g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 255 % Daily Value * Total Fat 7g 9% Saturated Fat 2g 9% Cholesterol 141mg 47% Sodium 2854mg 124% Total Carbohydrate 11g 4% Dietary Fiber 1g 2% Total Sugars 7g Protein 37g 73% Vitamin C 1mg 1% Calcium 32mg 2% Iron 3mg 16% Potassium 510mg 11% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Grilled Chicken Adobo 01 of 16 Photo by  LatinaCook 02 of 16 Photo by  Silk 01/18/2024 03 of 16 Photo by  Adam 01/16/2024 We enjoyed it very.much. made it with roasted potatoes but the suggestion of rice would have been a better pairing. The flavor was good and not over powering. Will definitely make it again. 04 of 16 Photo by  DaringMiso8626 10/16/2023 I only used one cup of low sodium soy salt. Everything else was the same. It was delicious. I would highly recommend it.I served it over basmati rice. 05 of 16 Photo by  lalilangelx650 11/25/2020 06 of 16 Photo by  michelleitsme 08/07/2018 07 of 16 Photo by  Rolando N 05/26/2017 08 of 16 Photo by  John T. Holden III 04/25/2017 09 of 16 Photo by  hugh 04/13/2017 Fantastic. Admittedly I added sesame oil, sesame seeds and a few tps of crushed red pepper. My additions are more my suiting. But the over all product was very tasty. 10 of 16 Photo by  LatinaCook 03/19/2012 I used low sodium soy sauce, and a little less than called for. I used rice vinegar and more garlic. Instead of grilling, I broiled the chicken for about 4 minutes. I reduced the sauce until it was pretty thick. The flavor concentrates quite a bit so... do as told by the submitter: "serve with just a little of the sauce, not too much". Very tasty! 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Laotian Grilled Chicken (Ping Gai) 49 Ratings Reshmi Kebab (Silken Kebabs) 20 Ratings Asian Grilled Chicken 240 Ratings Grilled Asian Chicken 552 Ratings Grilled Lemongrass Chicken 2 Ratings Singapore Satay 19 Ratings Thai Pork Satay 75 Ratings Hoisin-Glazed Chicken Thighs 18 Ratings Thai Grilled Chicken Thighs 1 Rating Grilled Peanut Chicken 438 Ratings Juicy Grilled Chicken Breasts 504 Ratings Hawaiian Chicken Pineapple Kabobs 798 Ratings Garlic Ranch Chicken 152 Ratings Tsukune (Japanese Chicken Meatballs) Chicken Kabobs 59 Ratings New York Finger Lakes Chicken 11 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: HEART-OF-MIDLOTHIAN
instructions: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat, and lightly oil grate.;In a large pot, mix soy sauce, water, vinegar, honey, garlic, bay leaves, and pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil, and place the chicken into the pot. Reduce heat, cover, and cook 35 to 40 minutes.;Remove chicken, drain on paper towels, and set aside. Discard bay leaves. Return the mixture to a boil, and cook until reduced to about 1 1/2 cups.;Place chicken on the prepared grill, about 5 minutes on each side, until browned and crisp. Serve with the remaining soy sauce mixture.
